solution.text:
Since X and Y are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K =\( 70 \times 15 = 1050\)
Hence, when x = \(350\)
y =\( \frac {1050}{350}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) y = 3

content.text: x= 70 when y = 15. Find y when x = 350.

y =\( \frac {2736}{8}\)

solution.text:
Since Number of workers and number of days are inversely proportional XY = K
Therefore, K \(= 1 \times 40\)
Now, 24 hours = 1 day
Therefore number of workers to complete job in one day \(= \frac K1 = \frac {40}{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of workers = 40

content.text: One worker can complete a job in 40 days. How many workers will it take to complete the same job in 24 hours?

So, if the quantity of the item(x) increases the price of the item(y) decreases and vice versa.
The two quantities are inversely proportional.

State whether the following quantities are inversely proportional or not:

hint.text: Remember that any two quantities that can be represented as xy=k, where k is a proportionality constant are inversely proportional to each other.

solution.text:
Since the distance of the race is a constant = 1600 m
Therefore, we know the number of participants taking part and distance each participant runs are inversely proportional
Number of participants x distance each runs = total distance of race
16 \(\times\) Distance run by each participant = 1600
Distance run by each participant = \( \frac{1600}{16}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Distance run by each participant = 100 m

content.text: A 1600 metre relay race, has 4 participants in each team. Due to bad organisation, 4 times the participants come from each school and the rules are changed such that now each team has 16 participants. How much distance does each participant run?
Answer the question below:

hint.text: The number of participants taking part and the distance each participant runs are inversely proportional.

solution.text:
Since Area is constant, Length and Breadth are inversely proportional. L \(\times\) B = A = K
Therefore, taking area constant, K = 70 \(\times\) 25 = 1750 cm\(^2\)
Hence, if Length = 50 cm
Breadth =\( \frac {1750}{50}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Breadth = 35 cm

content.text: The length and breadth of a given rectangle are 70 and 25 cm. Given that the area remains constant find the breadth of the rectangle when length is 50 cm.

hint.text: Volume of cylinder = Pi x radius\(^2\) x height

solution.text:
Since Volume is constant, the square of radius of cylinder and height are inversely proportional.
Pi \(\times\) Radius\(^2\) \(\times\) Height = Volume = k. Therefore \( r^2 \times h \)= K [Pi is a constant]
Therefore, taking case 1, \(40^2 \times 80 \)= K
Hence, K= 128000
If Height= 20 cm
Radius\(^2 = \frac{K}{height}\)
Radius\(^2 = \frac{128000}{20}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Radius = 80 cm

content.text: The volume of a right angle solid cylinder is constant. If the height of the cylinder is 80 and Radius is 40 cm. Find the radius of the cylinder when the height is 20 cm.

solution.text:
Since distance between A and B is constant, speed and time are inversely proportional.
Speed \(\times\) time = Distance = K
But first we convert all time to minutes. Therefore,
1 hour = 60 min
Time taken by auto rickshaw = 600 min
Therefore now in case one, K = \( 600 \times 30\)
K = 18000
In the case of the car, speed = 120 km/h
Therefore time taken = \( \frac {K}{120} = \frac {18000}{120}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Time taken by car = 150 min

content.text: An auto rickshaw travels between two places A and B in 10 hours at the constant speed of 30 km/h. If a car travels at constant speed of 120 km/h, How many minutes will it take from A to B?
Solve the following:

hint.text: Each of the above quantities can be represented as inversely proportional to one another. Take a multiple of the two quantities in such a way that XY = k (proportionality constant)

solution.text:
Since the total number of workers = 100
Workers who leave the team = 50
Therefore, Workers left for the second time = 100- 50 = 50
Since the numbers of workers and number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional we get,
\( 128 \times 100\) = Constant
\(50 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time) = Constant
Therefore,\( 128 \times 100 = 50 \times \) (No. of days to complete job second time)
Number of days to complete job second time =\( \frac {128 \times 100}{50} \)
\(\Rightarrow\) Number of days to complete the job second time = 256

content.text: You are a contractor and are given a contract to pave a road. It takes you 100 trained workers and 128 days to finish the job. Unfortunately there is a problem and you must redo all the work again. 50 workers leave your team. How much time will it take the remaining to redo the work and complete the job for a second time?
Answer the question below:

hint.text: The total number of workers and the number of days to finish the job are inversely proportional
